attributes.action: Put pressure on Mr Kagame and Rwanda's government for true democracy
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Call for Democracy and Justice in Rwanda

As the Rwandan President, is about to visit Great Britain and officially welcome in the Commonwealth, we the undersigned, petition the British government to question the credentials of the new member.

Just a few examples of oppression and injustice:

Before this year presidential elections scheduled for Aug 9:
• The United Democratic Forces UDF-Inkingi constitutional congress has been postponed because the Rwandan local authority failed to respond to the application submitted; the party leadership is constantly harassed and imprisoned.
• The Democratic Green Party of Rwanda was forbidden to hold its congresses
• The Party Social IMBERAKULI had dissolution threats after a smear campaign against its chairperson
.Overcrowding of prisons, with nearly 2% of the population, many of whom without a judiciary dossier for more than 15 years, is another factor that aggravates the social deprivation and lack of justice. 

We call upon Mr Brown to ask Mr Kagame to let Rwandans have democracy and justice and to let opposition parties have space to operate, without fear of harassment and imprisonment.

rejection.details: As we cannot verify all of the statements in your petition, we cannot accept it as it is currently worded. We suggest you remove these statements or make it clear they are allegations.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
